newsitem.title: HONG KONG: China Construction Bank US$200 FRN group forms.
newsitem.headline: China Construction Bank US$200 FRN group forms.

text.p: A management group has formed for China Construction Bank's US$200 million floating rate notes issue due 2002, bookrunner Merrill Lynch Far East said.

The five-year notes were issued at par and re-offered at a fixed 99.871. They pay a coupon of 30 basis points over the six-month London Interbank Offered Rate and a fixed re-offer yield of 33 basis points over LIBOR.

Fees are 25 basis points split as 10 basis points for management and underwriting and 15 basis points for selling. There is a praecipium of 12.5 basis points which is to be added to the management and underwriting fees.
Lead managers are Bayerische Landesbank Hong Kong, Daiwa Securities (HK), Development Bank of Singapore, Merrill Lynch Far East and Sakura Finance Asia.
Co-lead managers are Fuji International Finance, HSBC Markets, LTCB Asia, Paribas Capital Markets, Sanwa International Finance and SBC Warburg.

Co-managers are BA Asia, Bear Stearns Asia, BOC International, Baden-Wurttembergische Bank, CARIPLO Hong Kong, CITIC Industrial Bank, Dresdner (South East Asia), Industrial and Commercial Bank of China, Malayan Banking Berhad, SanPaolo Bank Singapore and Tokyo-Mitsubishi International (HK). The payment date is April 11.
